snippet.title: Eurozone unemployment lowest since 2009
snippet.content: Unemployment in the eurozone continued to fall in June to 9.1 per cent, the lowest rate recorded since February 2009, Eurostat, the EU's statistics agency, says. The number of unemployed people in the eurozone fell to 14.7 million in June, a decrease of 183,000 from May, when the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate stood at 9.2 per cent. Greece continued to have the highest unemployment rate in the 19-country eurozone and European Union as a whole with 21.7 per cent in June, which is down from 22.5 per cent in May. The lowest rates of unemployment were recorded in the Czech Republic at 2.9 per cent, Germany 3.8 per cent and Malta 4.1 per cent. The rate in the 28 EU member states as a whole remained stable at 7.7 per cent, the lowest figure recorded since December 2008.
